intro: Imperata cylindrica var. mexicana, commonly known as Mexican needlegrass, is a perennial grass native to the Americas. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and long, narrow leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces spiky, cylindrical inflorescences that are often used in floral arrangements. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Mexican needlegrass is often found in disturbed areas and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
